definition: morning and evening visits to parents/cf 昏定晨省[hun1 ding4 chen2 xing3]

sentences.english: The name for this border between lunar night and day is the terminator line.
sentences.chinese: 我们把月亮上的黑白边界线叫做‘晨昏线’。

sentences.english: The scenery changes from morning to evening, from season to season.
sentences.chinese: 一年四季，晨昏景色各有不同。

sentences.english: The men at the bar laughed. The wine was poured.
sentences.chinese: 我已经晨昏不分，酒吧里的人都大笑起来，酒打翻了。

sentences.english: Sorry, I just can't stop loving you.
sentences.chinese: 我爱你，穿越千年，无论晨昏。

sentences.english: At least one dress rehearsal should be performed in dark twilight.
sentences.chinese: 至少应在晨昏时进行一项实际操作练习。

sentences.english: There will be no more sunrises, no minutes, hours or days.
sentences.chinese: 当时刻到来，你不再有分分秒秒也没有晨昏昼夜。

sentences.english: Of night and light and the half-light.
sentences.chinese: 为黑夜，白昼和晨昏穿戴。

sentences.english: Miss you, in mornings, in nights, as naturally as birds sing.
sentences.chinese: 念你不分晨昏，犹如鸟儿鸣唱。

definition: the four seasons/spring, summer, autumn and winter
day and night/period of 24 hours/continuously, without stop
from dawn to dusk/all the time
the four seasons, namely: spring 春, summer 夏, autumn 秋 and winter 冬
the sun and moon/day and month/every day and every month/season/life and livelihood
lit. morning bell, evening drum, symbolizing monastic practice (idiom); fig. encouragement to study or progress
see 清風明月|清风明月[qing1 feng1 ming2 yue4]
